instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
both boards will boot to macOS if disabled AppleCameraInterface.kext
both boards will boot to macOS if I removed Camera IC (<CHIP>U3900</CHIP>) and enable AppleCameraInterface.kext

I've replaced <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> on both boards but still stuck on AppleCamIN.

maybe original <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> was never bad.

any suggestions? bad communication to the PCH?


[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/OpGKcvS.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
Did you try new SSD installation?
Test it with an USB OSX at least.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
its booted off an external USB drive. cam works fine on another known working board in the same chassis and screen.
its a new osx, I've even made two osx. one without cam.kext out and another one with camera.kext driver.

i don't think its ME region related. but have already tried new clean me region etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
Run ASD/MRI and see if something strange pops up.
Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
asd nothing came up on both units

was liquid damaged and didn't power on. so i've fixed all that. just the camera problem now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message: Try changing the RAM chip connected to camera chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on progress bar with AppleCamIN
threads.message:
On the 3437 it was <RESISTOR>R2042</RESISTOR>.

Before replacement :
- <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_CAMERA</SIGNAL> = 0.3V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL> = 1.6V
- <RESISTOR>R2042</RESISTOR> = 8 Mohms
After replacement :
- <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_CAMERA</SIGNAL> = 0.56V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <RESISTOR>R2042</RESISTOR> = 0 ohm

Now for the stuff that doesn't make sense :
- Camera was working 100% fine under Linux.
- macOS was stalling during boot towards end of progress bar then suddenly rebooting. It was booting fine albeit with camera not working if communication between PCH and camera IC was disabled (removing <RESISTOR>R2030</RESISTOR> or removing the caps on the PCIe bus for example).
- The clock did look fine on the oscilloscope, correct frequency and proper amplitude. Just a lower duty cycle than a known good board.

As a side note, removing camera RAM didn't change the symptoms, but once <RESISTOR>R2042</RESISTOR> was replaced it booted fine without camera RAM. Obviously camera wasn't working, but after reballing camera RAM everything works.
Prior to finding the bad <RESISTOR>R2042</RESISTOR>, multiple camera IC were tried by Alan. I tried a known good clean ME EFI and clock generator, they didn't solve the problem in this case but they could cause similar symptoms anyway.

According to Alan, with verbose mode Sierra/Mojave were freezing on :
[CODE]AppleCamIn::init
AppleCamIn::probe
AppleCamIn::start[/CODE]

I booted Big Sur in verbose and I didn't get these messages, it was freezing at :
[CODE]IOG Flags 0x3
Generation from SMC report as 2[/CODE]
